oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Photograph of an American unit standing in front of tents
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: This photograph shows an American unit standing in formation in front of their shelter tents. The photograph belonged to Dallas Walton Newsom of North Carolina. He was appointed into the Reserve Officer Training Camp from Trinity College (now Duke Univ.). He attended the course of instruction at Plattsburg, NY. He returned to Trinity College after the war. Three horse mounted officers stand between rows. Each soldier carried half of a tent. When buttoned with that of another it created a two-man tent.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: World War, 1914-1918; World War, 1914-1918 - History
